defs.docs: Utilities for working with Tokio.

attributes.value: / Convert a stream of byte chunks into an [`AsyncRead`](tokio::io::AsyncRead).
/ The item should be a [`Result`] with the ok variant being something that
/ implements the [`Buf`] trait (e.g. `Vec<u8>` or `Bytes`). The error
/ should be convertible into an [io error].

defs.name: DropGuard
defs.docs:
A wrapper for cancellation token which automatically cancels
 it on drop. It is created using `drop_guard` method on the `CancellationToken`.

defs.name: disarm
defs.docs:
Returns stored cancellation token and removes this drop guard instance
 (i.e. it will no longer cancel token). Other guards for this token
 are not affected.

/ Tasks can call [`CancellationToken::cancelled()`] in order to

defs.name: poll_send_done
defs.value:
pub fn poll_send_done(&mut Self, &mut Context)
-> Poll<Result<(), SendError<T>>>
defs.docs:
If a send is in progress, poll for its completion. If no send is in progress,
 this method returns `Poll::Ready(Ok(()))`.

attributes.value: / If a send is in progress, poll for its completion. If no send is in progress,
/ This method can return the following values:
/  - `Poll::Ready(Ok(()))` if the in-progress send has been completed, or there is
/    no send in progress (even if the channel is closed).
/  - `Poll::Ready(Err(err))` if the in-progress send failed because the channel has
/  - `Poll::Pending` if a send is in progress, but it could not complete now.
/ When this method returns `Poll::Pending`, the current task is scheduled
/ to receive a wakeup when the message is sent, or when the entire channel
/ is closed (but not if just this sender is closed by
/ `close_this_sender`). Note that on multiple calls to `poll_send_done`,
/ only the `Waker` from the `Context` passed to the most recent call is
/ If this method returns `Poll::Ready`, then `start_send` is guaranteed to

/ If there is a send in progress when this method is called, that send is

pub fn poll_acquire(&mut Self, &mut Context)
-> Poll<Option<OwnedSemaphorePermit>>
defs.docs: Poll to acquire a permit from the semaphore.

attributes.value: / Poll to acquire a permit from the semaphore.
/ This can return the following values:
/  - `Poll::Pending` if a permit is not currently available.
/  - `Poll::Ready(None)` if the semaphore has been closed.
/ When this method returns `Poll::Pending`, the current task is scheduled
/ to receive a wakeup when a permit becomes available, or when the
/ semaphore is closed. Note that on multiple calls to `poll_acquire`, only
/ the `Waker` from the `Context` passed to the most recent call is

defs.value: pub enum Either<L, R> { Left(L), Right(R), }
defs.docs: Combines two different futures, streams, or sinks having the same associated types into a single type.

attributes.value: / Combines two different futures, streams, or sinks having the same associated types into a single type.
/ This type implements common asynchronous traits such as [`Future`] and those in Tokio.
/ The following code will not work:
/         other_async_function() // <- Will print: "`if` and `else` have incompatible types"
/ When the output type is the same, we can wrap each future in `Either` to avoid the
